locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explores the narrative of David and Jonathan to define the necessity, elements (constancy, transparency, sympathy), and power of friendship, culminating in Christ as the ultimate friend.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Uses narrative arcs and Proverbs to build a biblical-theological definition of friendship.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting truths about friendship and Christ's work, with a late shift toward promising and declaring the availability of Christ's friendship.
voorbeelden: Jesus Christ looks down from the cross and sees people... and he stayed.
He saved you through his friendship.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: The hearer feels the weight of their loneliness and finds security in the sacrificial friendship of Jesus, leading to transformed human relationships.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit in the closing prayer, but largely focused on the Christological foundation.

voorbeelden: The narrative arcs are longer in this part of the Bible.
I know this boggles everybody’s mind.
He promises you life (implied in 'He saved you')
His transparency can become the basis for your transparency.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong theological grounding, but often framed as possibilities rather than direct 'I promise you' address.

voorbeelden: You are saved by that friendship.
declaratieven.autoriteit: High authority in the 'Christological turn' at the end of the sermon.

indicatoren: Extensive 'talking about' the definition of friendship.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed and intellectually convinced but remains an observer for the first 15 minutes.

missende_elementen: Immediate commissive address early in the sermon.
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Delayed encounter with the Word as an event.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: The 'Toezegging' is concentrated in the final movement, linking Christ's work to the hearer's status.
voorbeelden: You are saved by that friendship.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Directly addressing the hearer's experience of loneliness and need.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used heavily in the final application of the Gospel.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing David, Jonathan, Saul, and the Trinity.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Necessary for exegesis but creates a 'lecture' feel in the first half.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Definitions of friendship and theological truths.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Avoids simple moralism (Be a friend -> So God loves you).

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Friendship is vital) -> Declarative (Christ is the friend who died for you) -> Directive (Go and be friends).
voorbeelden: Jesus' radical transparency... is the basis for your transparency.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Excellent logical flow from indicative to imperative.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: If you laid down your life for me... I can lay down my life now for others.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: Despite a heavy constative start, the sermon successfully transitions into a performative event by grounding the human need for friendship in the finished work of Christ.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: He stayed on the cross. He was constant. He was a true friend.

zwakke_punten.probleem: Takes up significant space that could be used for direct address.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event when it stops talking about David and starts declaring Christ's friendship to the 'monster' in the hearer.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The word 'forgives' and 'saved' are used with illocutionary force in the final third.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Implicit; the preacher speaks as a mandatory of the Gospel.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Strongly evident in the final appeal.
tekstueel_bewijs: Are you looking for that friend? Here he is.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Low in the body, present in the prayer.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The preacher trusts the truth of the Gospel to effect change.
tekstueel_bewijs: We ask that Jesus’ saving friendship could be the basis...

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon offers Christ as the solution to the human condition.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: The description of the cross is epiphanic.
tekstueel_bewijs: His arms are open to you. More than that, they’re nailed open.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Shift from 'is' (descriptive) to 'gives/forgives/promises' (performative) earlier in the text.

specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: The Triune God invites you into His eternal friendship today.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from an intellectual fact to a present invitation.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is buried in the conclusion.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Interweave the promise of Christ's constancy during the 'Constancy' section.
voorbeeldzinnen: Even when your human friends fail, Christ promises: I will never let you down.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Maintain the strong 'You' address found in the final section.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Ensure the 'wound of a friend' is applied to the hearer's relationship with God first.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of moving from biblical narrative to the 'Event' of the Gospel.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT identifies that the preacher isn't just sending a 'message' about friendship, but is the means through which Christ's friendship is enacted.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power is not in the Frankenstein story, but in the Declarative 'You are saved'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's success depends on the shift from 3rd person history to 2nd person promise.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: You are saved by that friendship.

appendices.notities: The sermon follows a classic 'Kellerian' structure: Need -> Definition -> Christ as Fulfillment -> New Life.
